itemDescription: George Cross recipient in World War II

wikipedia_page.main: Captain Jenkin Robert Oswald Thompson GC (13 July 1911 – 24 January 1944) was posthumously awarded the George Cross for conspicuous gallantry and devotion to duty. He was awarded the decoration for the courage he showed while serving as a captain in the Royal Army Medical Corps on board HM Hospital Carriers Paris and St. David in Sicily and Anzio.

link_mentions.page: List of people from the London Borough of Hammersmith and Fulham
response: * Jenkin Thompson, captain in the Royal Army Medical Corps during World War II, recipient of the George Cross; born in Fulham.
